GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1967 as Institut de gestion du personnel et d'organisation du travail (IGEPOT). Transfered to the newly created Université nationale du Zaïre (UNAZA) 1971, in which it started operating as a department of the Faculty of Educational Sciences. Renamed Institut de gestion des entreprises (IGE) 1981 that was progressively transformed into Institut supérieur de commerce (ISCOM). Acquired autonomy 1981. Acquired current title 1982. Belogns to the UNAZA university network, which also includes Université de Kisangani (UNIKIS), Institut supérieur de commerce de Kinshasa (ISC Kinshasa), Université de Lubumbashi (UNILU)

Address.university_name: Institut national du bâtiment et des travaux publics – INBTP-KIN (INBTP)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1961 as INBTP. Merged with Institut supérieur des géomètres experts immobiliers (ISGEI), a private institution, 1969. Merged with Institut supérieur d’architecture (ISA) et l’Institut supérieur des arts plastiques (ISAP) to form the Institut national des travaux publics (INTP) 1971. Integrated into Université Nationale du Zaïre as UNAZA/INTP 1972. Became IBTP 1981, following dissolution of UNAZA. Split into two institutions 2010. Institut national du bâtiment et des travaux publics (INBTP) and Institut supérieur d’architecture et d'urbanisme (ISAU). Started implementing the LMD System 2019. Also 8 other public Instituts du bâtiment et des travaux publics (IBTP) spread accross the following provinces and cities: KasaÏ (Luebo), Kasai-Oriental (Mbuji-Mayi), Kongo-Central (Matadi), Maniema (Kindu), Nord-Kivu (Butembo), Sud-Kivu (Kamituga, Nyangezi), Tshopo (Kisangani); 1 private Institut du bâtiment et des travaux publics (IBTP) in Buta
